items.title: Comment Policy: Promoting Respect and Inclusion at AppOutlet
items.summary: At AppOutlet, we believe in fostering a welcoming and inclusive community where everyone can engage in thoughtful discussions about technology.
items.content_html:
At AppOutlet, we believe in fostering a welcoming and inclusive community where everyone can engage in thoughtful discussions about technology. We encourage our users to express their ideas, opinions, and expertise while maintaining a respectful and courteous environment. To achieve this goal, we have implemented the following comment policy:

  1. Be Kind and Respectful: Treat others with respect and empathy. Refrain from using offensive language, personal attacks, or any form of discrimination based on race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, or any other characteristic. Disagreements are natural, but express your opinions in a constructive manner.

  2. Stay On Topic: We value relevant discussions related to technology and the topics covered in our articles. Please keep your comments focused and avoid straying into unrelated or divisive subjects.

  3. No Spam or Self-Promotion: Avoid posting promotional content or spammy links. Our comment section is meant for meaningful contributions and discussions.

  4. Cite Sources and Provide Evidence: When referencing facts, statistics, or information, cite credible sources to support your claims. Evidence-based discussions contribute to a more informed community.

  5. Respect Privacy and Copyrights: Do not share personal information about others, and refrain from posting content that violates copyright or intellectual property rights.

  6. Encourage Diversity of Thought: Embrace diverse perspectives and engage in discussions with an open mind. Different viewpoints enrich our community and lead to deeper insights.

  7. Flag Inappropriate Content: Help us maintain a respectful environment by flagging comments that violate our policies. Our moderation team will review flagged content promptly.

  8. Moderation Process: Our moderators will review comments to ensure they adhere to our guidelines. We reserve the right to remove comments that violate our policies. In cases of repeated violations, we may take further action, including warning users or disabling commenting privileges.

  9. Contribute to a Safe Space: Be mindful that the internet is a global platform, and not everyone shares the same cultural background or experiences. Strive to create a safe and inclusive space for all participants.

  10. Empower Each Other: If you witness disrespectful behaviour or notice someone feeling unwelcome, consider stepping in with a gentle reminder of our community guidelines. Encouraging each other to abide by the rules helps strengthen our community.

By participating in discussions on AppOutlet, you agree to adhere to this comment policy. We value your contributions and commitment to maintaining a respectful and inclusive atmosphere. Let's work together to make AppOutlet a place where everyone can feel comfortable sharing their ideas and learning from one another. Thank you for being a part of our community!

items.title: üéÆ Introducing GameOutlet v1.3.3 üöÄ
items.summary: We're thrilled to unveil the latest version of GameOutlet - your one-stop destination for unbeatable gaming deals and promotions! With…
items.content_html:
We're thrilled to unveil the latest version of GameOutlet - your one-stop destination for unbeatable gaming deals and promotions! With GameOutlet v1.3.3, we've raised the bar to make your gaming experience more thrilling, personalized, and convenient than ever before. Let's dive into the exciting updates that await you:

1. Unleash Your Savings Power! üí∞

Ever wondered how much you're saving with each deal? Wonder no more! With GameOutlet v1.3.3, we're introducing a revolutionary feature that displays the percentage of savings you enjoy with every game purchase. Say goodbye to second-guessing and embrace gaming with confidence, knowing you're making the most of every discount!

¬†

2. Seamless Theme Adaptation üé®

Personalisation is the key to creating your perfect gaming environment. GameOutlet v1.3.3 now includes a listener to your system theme, allowing the application to dynamically adjust its theme to match yours. Whether you prefer a sleek Dark theme for late-night gaming or a bright Light theme to keep things fresh, GameOutlet adapts to your preferences in real-time!

3. Enhanced Language Support üåç

We value diversity and inclusivity in our gaming community. That's why, with GameOutlet v1.3.3, we've doubled down on language support. Our improved Italian and Dutch language enhancements ensure a seamless and engaging experience for our Italian and Dutch-speaking users. Embrace the power of language and enjoy GameOutlet in your native tongue!

Update Now & Unleash the Power of GameOutlet!

Get ready to immerse yourself in a world of gaming delights with GameOutlet v1.3.3. Download it now and share the excitement with your gaming community. Remember to leave your feedback, suggestions, and experiences; your input helps us to deliver the best.

Download GameOutlet

GameOutlet v1.3.3 - Your gaming adventure awaits. Let's play together! üéÆ‚ú®

items.title: Introducing GameOutlet 1.3.1: Enhanced About Screen and Flathub Availability!
items.summary: We‚Äôre excited to announce the release of GameOutlet version 1.3.1, packed with new features and improvements to enhance your gaming…
items.content_html:
We‚Äôre excited to announce the release of GameOutlet version 1.3.1, packed with new features and improvements to enhance your gaming experience! Download and install GameOutlet now to take advantage of these exciting updates.

New Features:

  1. Theme Selection: We believe personalization is key, so we‚Äôre introducing theme selection in GameOutlet! Choose between Light, Dark, or System Default themes to match your preferences and create a personalized gaming environment.

  1. About Screen: Get to know GameOutlet better with our new About screen. Access information about the application, including the version, authors, and social media channels. We also provide convenient links to our donation channels for those who want to support the project.

Available on Flathub:

We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that GameOutlet is now available on Flathub! Flathub is a popular platform for discovering and installing applications on various Linux distributions. Find GameOutlet on Flathub and enjoy seamless installation and updates for your favorite gaming deals app.

Other Improvements:

We‚Äôve listened to your feedback and made some enhancements in GameOutlet 1.3.1:

  • Improved Translation: We‚Äôve worked hard to improve the translation for Russian and Portuguese, ensuring a smoother and more localized experience for our users.

We invite you to join our growing community of gamers and start exploring the world of fantastic gaming deals with GameOutlet. Don‚Äôt miss out on the latest promotions and discounts across multiple game stores!

Download and install GameOutlet 1.3.1 today.

If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to reach out to us through our support channels.

Let the gaming journey begin with GameOutlet!

items.title: Karavel discontinuation
items.summary: üì¢ Dear Karavel users, I hope this message finds you well. Today, I have an important announcement to share with…
items.content_html:
üì¢ Dear Karavel users,

I hope this message finds you well. Today, I have an important announcement to share with you regarding the future of Karavel, the navigation library for Jetpack Compose applications.

After careful consideration, we have made the difficult decision to discontinue the development and maintenance of Karavel. Our team consists of only one person, and with the increasing demands of managing our other applications, AppOutlet and GameOutlet, it has become challenging to allocate the necessary resources to maintain Karavel effectively.

We understand that this news may come as a disappointment to many of you who have come to rely on Karavel for your Jetpack Compose projects. However, we believe it's crucial to prioritize the quality and sustainability of our existing applications.

But fret not! We have some excellent alternatives to recommend, which are well-maintained and more mature: Voyager (https://voyager.adriel.cafe/) and Decompose (https://arkivanov.github.io/Decompose/). These libraries offer robust navigation solutions for Jetpack Compose applications and are backed by dedicated teams committed to their continued development.

Thank you for your understanding and for being a part of our journey. We remain dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences with our other applications, and we are excited to see what you will create with Voyager or Decompose. Should you have any questions or need assistance during the transition, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Wishing you continued success and happy coding!

Best regards, Messias Junior from AppOutlet team

items.title: GameOutlet 1.1.3
items.summary: This week we released version 1.1.3 with improvements in the game screen and a new feature "Wishlist". There is some…
items.content_html:
This week we released version 1.1.3 with improvements in the game screen and a new feature "Wishlist".

The game details screen

There is some visual changes:

  • Now we have a toolbar with the "navigation back" icon, the game title and a option to add this game to de favories. This last part works with the new feature. "Wishlist"
  • The deals list is more clean and shows the "FREE" label when the game is free

Wishlist

We are introducing the wishlist in this release. A screen where the user can see its favorite games.¬†

Windows support

After some time of investigation, I finally was able to find the problem that prevents us from running a release version of GameOutlet in Windows hosts. The issues were already solved and we have a usable Windows version.

We also applied a change to make the Windows title bar integrated into the application background.

These were the updates for this version.

You can download the current version of GameOutlet in the link below¬†

Download GameOutlet

Thank you! See you next time üëã

items.title: GameOutlet 1.0.1
items.summary: The AppOutlet team is proud to announce that we have released the first version of the GameOutlet. GameOutlet is a…
items.content_html:
The AppOutlet team is proud to announce that we have released the first version of the GameOutlet.

GameOutlet is a application that works like an aggregator of the best prices from the most popular PC games online stores.

Features

In this version you can

  • See the latests deals
  • See the deals from a game and be taken to the store page
  • Search by your favourite game

Future

In the future, we are planning to add more features like:

  • Wishlist
  • Alerts
  • Deals sharing

as well as an Windows version.

For more information, please see the project page in Github

Thank you!

¬†

items.title: üéäÔ∏è Karavel 1.0.2 was released!
items.summary: Karavel is one of our projects that is currently being developed. It is an simple and lightweight navigation library for…
items.content_html:
Karavel is one of our projects that is currently being developed. It is an simple and lightweight navigation library for desktop applications using Kotlin and Compose for desktop!

Now it is available on Maven Central.

The first version of Karavel was available only over Jitpack package registry. The version 1.0.2 (and the next ones) can be downloaded direcly from maven central repository.

Other improvements

Besides that the new release also has new versions of Kotlin and Compose dependencies.

You can checkout karavel documentation an code on Karavel github repository

If you are developing desktop applications with compose, please consider using Karavel to navigate between your composables!

See you next time! ‚õµÔ∏è

Some useful links

  • Maven central
  • Compose Multiplatform

items.title: The version 2.1.0 was released!
items.summary: In this version we mainly released some theme and snaps support improvements. Now, you can select the system theme on…
items.content_html:
In this version we mainly released some theme and snaps support improvements.

System theme

Now, you can select the system theme on the theme list. This way, we can detect whether you are using a light or dark theme and show you the one that fits it.

Snaps are back in town!

We solved the snap indexing issue that we had an you are already are able to find any snap on App Outlet!

Minor improvements

  • Now we are caching the snaps data after the search
  • The links from patreon and open collective were replaced by the Ko-fi one

The detailed changelog can be found here

We hope you are enjoying these new changes and we see you in next one!

items.title: App Outlet: A universal Linux app store
items.summary: App outlet screenshots App Outlet is an application store for Linux distributions focused on delivering applications released in distro-agnostic packages…
items.content_html:
App Outlet is an application store for Linux distributions focused on delivering applications released in distro-agnostic packages (snap, flatpak, AppImage). That's why the ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù is in the subtitle.

The old and the new Linux packaging style

Before the creation of the distro-agnostic packages, there were two main pre-compiled packages that were distributed over their respective distros:¬†.deb¬†to Debian and their based distros and¬†.rpm¬†to the Red Rat Enterprise Linux (a.k.a RHEL) and its derivates.

This architecture could cause some instability problems given the way that the dependencies are managed. Installing software that has a specific dependency could break another or the entire system depending on the size of the change.

These new software packaging tools aim to solve this problem by bringing a more ‚Äúself-contained‚Äù approach. The application's dependencies are already bundled to the deliverable, mitigating the risk of dependencies crashes.

Besides that, these new packages provide mode features regarding security like sandboxing, permissions management.

It‚Äôs not all flowers

Like every new stuff, the new packages bring some issues: Startup time, theme integration and decentralized distribution (the problem that we will try to solve today).

Each package type has its own way to distribute the application, its own store. Flatpak has the¬†Flathub. Snap has the¬†Snapstore. AppImage doesn‚Äôt even have an installation tool or a formal store but there are some independent distributors like¬†AppImageHub.com¬†and¬†appimage.github.io. So every time you need to search for new software to install you need to go to several sites, download the package and then install it on your machine.

Some distros have integrations on their own application stores but the distros have preferences of a specific package and don't provide an easy way to get the counterpart.

That‚Äôs why the App Outlet was created.

App Outlet to the rescue

App outlet fetch data from the Snapstore, Flathub and appimage.github.io, show the applications in a user-friendly way and provide an easy way to install and remove your favourite applications!

You can just search by an application title and a list of applications is shown to you. You just need to select the application and click on the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button.

How to get it?

You can¬†download the App Outlet here, in the files section.

The older releases also can be found o the Github repository.

Feel free to download it, test it and give you feedback to us.

If you are interested to contribute to the project, you can see the source code and a lot of other stuff on the Github repository.

References

  • https://docs.flatpak.org/en/latest/introduction.html#reasons-to-use-flatpak
  • https://snapcraft.io/store
  • https://flathub.org/home
  • https://appoutlet.github.io/
  • https://www.appimagehub.com/
  • https://appimage.github.io/apps/
  • https://github.com/appoutlet/appoutlet/

items.title: ‚òïÔ∏è¬† Now you can buy me a coffee¬†
items.summary: Aiming to make things easier and provide another way to the users support the App Outlet development, we created an…
items.content_html:
Aiming to make things easier and provide another way to the users support the App Outlet development, we created an account on Ko-fi!

We will use the Ko-fi platform to receive donations but also to share smaller and quick updates with the community. We will post the official anouncements here on this site.

What happens with the other sponsoring platforms?

Before creating this new account, we had an Patreon and an OpenCollective account. We decided to close it because we think that it does not fit our need like Ko-fi does.

Feel free to give us some feedback! I would love to hear what you are thinking about it!

Thank you for the support that you already give to us!
